sentences.english: Capello substituted him fearing a red card would follow.
sentences.chinese: 卡佩羅擔心維拉喫紅牌就把他換下場。

sentences.english: This is the seventh-consecutive day at this World Cup a player has been sent off.
sentences.chinese: 本屆世界盃已經連續7天有球員被紅牌罰下。

sentences.english: Give the owners the red card.
Play has not restarted, so retract the red card.
sentences.chinese: 在比賽還未重新開始的時候，先取消紅牌判罰。

sentences.english: The football player was red-carded and suspended from the game.
sentences.chinese: 那名足球運動員被亮了紅牌並受停賽處罰。

sentences.english: It also argued that Eboué should have seen a red card.
sentences.chinese: 也有人會說，應該給埃布埃一張紅牌。

sentences.english: Massimo Oddo was sent off in the Final of the Dubai Cup, as Benfica beat Lazio on penalties.
sentences.chinese: 奧多在比賽中被紅牌罰下，拉齊奧在點球大戰中失利。

sentences.english: Stop play and show the striker the red card for violent conduct.
sentences.chinese: 因爲該前鋒的暴力行爲，中止比賽並向他出示紅牌。

sentences.english: I have had two red cards this season - one of them I deserved but not this one.
sentences.chinese: 我對發生的事感到很遺憾，但是我不該得到那張紅牌。

sentences.english: USA overstepping again, red card again.
Mourinho explained, referring to the league match which saw John Terry red- carded .
sentences.chinese: 穆里尼奧解釋到，指的是那場被紅牌罰下的聯賽比賽。

sentences.english: In extreme cases the referee may send off a player by giving him a red card .
sentences.chinese: 如果嚴重犯規，裁判員可將球員紅牌罰出場。

sentences.english: A professional foul will often lead to a red card (see above).
sentences.chinese: 蓄意犯規一般會直接招致紅牌。

sentences.english: Show the abusive player a straight red card.
sentences.chinese: 向這名罵人的隊員直接出示紅牌。

sentences.english: Red card , it will earn me a one-match suspension.
sentences.chinese: 唯一遺憾的是我得到了一個紅牌。

sentences.english: Uruguay coach Oscar Tabarez did not comment on the red card.
sentences.chinese: 斯對裁判判罰的紅牌未予置評。

definition: to mess sth up/to screw up
to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
to heal a wound/to recuperate (from an injury)
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
half of a game or contest/half-court
St Paul/São Paulo, city in Brazil
